meanings.definition: To examine or assess something formally with the possibility or intention of instituting change if necessary.
meanings.sent1: I am reviewing my essay to make sure it meets all the requirements.
meanings.sent2: She spends hours reviewing her notes before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The detective was reviewing the evidence, trying to find the missing clue.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a magnifying glass, reviewing every detail of the painting.
meanings.sent5: He reviewed the contract with a fine-tooth comb, catching every mistake.

meanings.definition: To look back over something for analysis or evaluation.
meanings.sent1: After the project, we will be reviewing our performance to see what went well.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is reviewing the students' homework to provide feedback.
meanings.sent3: The cat was reviewing the knocked-over vase, trying to understand what happened.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a movie, reviewing scenes from the past.
meanings.sent5: He reviewed the old photos, reminiscing about the good times.

meanings.definition: To consider or discuss something again.
meanings.sent1: We are reviewing the proposal to see if there are any areas that need improvement.
meanings.sent2: The committee is reviewing the decision made last week.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were reviewing their argument, trying to find a compromise.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a courtroom, reviewing the evidence presented.
meanings.sent5: He reviewed his mistake, vowing not to repeat it.
